CatDescriptText: Mr. J. Merritt, 204 W. 114th Street, New York City, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 7, 1957, pg.3 with question: "Do you think it justifiable for residents to "put the finger" (notify law enforcement officers) on rackets if they exist in their respective communities?" answer reads: "I say 'yes.' That is the only way we're going to preserve decent government, regardless of any risk.  If corruption seeps in, the government will be in danger."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of J. Merritt, wearing dark tweed overcoat, dark cap, standing in front of stone block wall
